Title: Concepticon
Description: Links 9611 concepts from 51 different concept lists to 2206 different concept sets. 243 relations between concepts are defined.

Title: Database of Cross-Linguistic Colexifications
Description: Gives polysemy information for 221 different languages covering 64 families. Comprises a total of 301,498 words and 1,280 concepts.
Associated_Publication: List, J.-M., Terhalle, A., & Urban, M. (2013). Using network approaches to enhance the analysis of cross-linguistic polysemies. Proceedings of the 10th International Conference on Computational Semantics (pp. 347-353). Association for Computational Linguistics.

Title: The TV News Archive
Description: Contains more than 705,000 captioned and searchable news programs from over 4 years of U.S. television networks.

Title: SUBTLEX-NL
Description: Dutch word frequencies based on 44 million words from film and television subtitles.
Associated_Publication: Keuleers, E., Brysbaert, M. & New, B. (2010). SUBTLEX-NL: A new frequency measure for Dutch words based on film subtitles. Behavior Research Methods, 42(3), 643-650.

Title: SUBTLEX-CH
Description: Chinese word frequencies based on 33.5 million words from film and television subtitles.
Associated_Publication: Cai, Q., & Brysbaert, M. (2010). SUBTLEX-CH: Chinese word and character frequencies based on film subtitles. PLoS One, 5(6), e10729.

Title: SUBTLEX-GR
Description: Modern Greek word frequencies based on 23 million words from film and television subtitles.
Associated_Publication: Dimitropoulou, M., Du_abeitia, J., Avil_s, A., Corral, J.& Carreiras, M. (2010). Subtitle-based word frequencies as the best estimate of reading behaviour: the case of Greek.Frontiers in Psychology, 1:218, 1-12.

Title: SUBTLEX-PL
Description: Polish word frequencies based on 101 million words from film and television subtitles.
Associated_Publication: Mandera, P., Keuleers, E., Wodniecka, Z., & Brysbaert, M. (2014). Subtlex-pl: subtitle-based word frequency estimates for Polish. Behavior research methods, 47(2), 471-483.

Title: SUBTLEX-UK
Description: British English word frequencies based on 201.3 million words from 45,099 BBC broadcasts
Associated_Publication: Van Heuven, W.J.B., Mandera, P., Keuleers, E., & Brysbaert, M. (2014). Subtlex-UK: A new and improved word frequency database for British English. Quarterly Journal of Experimental Psychology, 67, 1176-1190.

Title: SUBTLEX-DE
Description: German word frequencies of 25.4 million words from film and television subtitles.
Associated_Publication: Brysbaert, M., Buchmeier, M., Conrad, M., Jacobs, A.M., B_lte, J., & B_hl, A. (2011). The word frequency effect: A review of recent developments and implications for the choice of frequency estimates in German. Experimental Psychology, 58, 412-424

Title: Digitales WÃ¶rterbuch der deutschen Sprache
Description: Over 100 million German word tokens based on different registers.

Title: Leipzig Wortschatz Lexicon
Description: German thesaurus and lexical network

Title: Leipzig Corpus Collection
Description: Contains frequencies and co-occurrence information for 219 languages.
Associated_Publication: Quasthoff, U., Richter, M., Biemann, C. (2006). Corpus Portal for Search in Monolingual Corpora. Proceedings of the fifth international conference on Language Resources and Evaluation, LREC 2006, Genoa, pp. 1799-1802.

Title: Leipzig Corpus Collection
Description: Contains corpora for 219 languages.
Associated_Publication: Quasthoff, U., Richter, M., Biemann, C. (2006). Corpus Portal for Search in Monolingual Corpora. Proceedings of the fifth international conference on Language Resources and Evaluation, LREC 2006, Genoa, pp. 1799-1802.

Title: Kuperman English Age-of-acquisition ratings
Description: Age-of-acquisition ratings for 30,000 English words.
Associated_Publication: Kuperman, V., Stadthagen-Gonzalez, H., & Brysbaert, M. (2012). Age-of-acquisition ratings for 30,000 English words. Behavior Research Methods, 44(4), 978-990.

Title: Warriner English Affective Ratings
Description: Valence, arousal and dominance ratings for 13,915 English words.
Associated_Publication: Warriner, A.B., Kuperman, V., & Brysbaert, M. (2013). Norms of valence, arousal, and dominance for 13,915 English lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 45, 1191-1207.

Title: Brysbaert English Concreteness Ratings
Description: Concreteness ratings for 40,000 English words.
Associated_Publication: Brysbaert, M., Warriner, A.B., & Kuperman, V. (2014). Concreteness ratings for 40 thousand generally known English word lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 46, 904-911.

Title: Brysbaert Dutch Age-of-acquisition & Concreteness ratings
Description: Age-of-acquisition and concreteness ratings for 30,000 Dutch words.
Associated_Publication: Brysbaert, M., Stevens, M., De Deyne, S., Voorspoels, W., & Storms, G. (2014). Norms of age of acquisition and concreteness for 30,000 Dutch words. Acta Psychologica, 150, 80-84.

Title: Moors Dutch Affective Ratings
Description: Valence, arousal and dominance ratings for 4,300 Dutch words.
Associated_Publication: Moors, A., De Houwer, J., Hermans, D., Wanmaker, S., van Schie, K., Van Harmelen, A. L., De Schryver, M., De Winne, J., & Brysbaert, M. (2013). Norms of valence, arousal, dominance, and age of acquisition for 4,300 Dutch words. Behavior research methods, 45(1), 169-177.

Title: French Lexicon Project
Description: Lexical decision data for 38,840 French words and 38,840 pseudowords.

Title: Lexique
Description: French lexical database for 135, 000 words.

Title: Malay Lexicon Project
Description: Malay lexical database for 9,592 words.

Title: English Lexicon Project
Description: English lexical database for 40,481 words.
Associated_Publication: Balota, D. A., Yap, M. J., Hutchison, K. A., Cortese, M. J., Kessler, B., Loftis, B., Neely, J. H., Nelson, D. L., Simpson, G. B., & Treiman, R. (2007). The English lexicon project. Behavior research methods, 39(3), 445-459.

Title: Dutch Lexicon Project
Description: Dutch lexical database for 14,000 words.
Associated_Publication: Keuleers, E., Diependaele, K., & Brysbaert, M. (2010). Practice effects in large-scale visual word recognition studies: A lexical decision study on 14,000 Dutch mono-and disyllabic words and nonwords. Frontiers in Psychology, 1, 174.

Title: British Lexicon Project
Description: British English lexical database for 28,000 words.

Title: Dutch Word Knowledge & Prevalence
Description: Word prevalence values for 54,319 Dutch words from nearly 300,000 participants.

Title: Modality Exclusivity Norms for Adjectives

Title: MRC Psycholinguistics Database
Description: Lexical database for English.
Associated_Publication: Coltheart, M. (1981). The MRC Psycholinguistic Database. Quarterly Journal of Experimental Psychology, 33A, 497-505.; Wilson, M.D. (1988). The MRC Psycholinguistic Database: Machine Readable Dictionary, Version 2. Behavioural Research Methods, Instruments and Computers, 20, 6-11.

Title: SUBTLEX-US
Description: Frequencies from 51 million word tokens.
Associated_Publication: Brysbaert, M., & New, B. (2009). Moving beyond Ku_era and Francis: A critical evaluation of current word frequency norms and the introduction of a new and improved word frequency measure for American English. Behavior Research Methods, 41, 977-990.; Brysbaert, M., New, B., & Keuleers, E. (2012). Adding part-of-speech information to the SUBTLEX-US word frequencies. Behavior research methods, 44(4), 991-997.

Title: British National Corpus
Description: Corpus based with 100 million words.

Title: World Atlas of Language Structures (WALS)
Description: Typological database
Associated_Publication: Dryer, Matthew S. & Haspelmath, Martin (eds.) (2013). The World Atlas of Language Structures Online. Leipzig: Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology.

Title: The World Loanword Database (WOLD)
Description: Loanword database with mini-dictionaries for 41 languages; words are coded for likelihood of being a loanword
Associated_Publication: Haspelmath, M., & Tadmor, U. (Eds.). (2009). Loanwords in the world's languages: a comparative handbook. Walter de Gruyter.

Title: Semantic Feature Norms
Description: Semantic feature norms for 541 concepts from 725 participants.

Title: Google Ngram
Description: One of the largest corpus available, with data from English, German, French, Italian, Spanish, Russian, Chinese and Hebrew.
Associated_Publication: Michel, J. B., Shen, Y. K., Aiden, A. P., Veres, A., Gray, M. K., Pickett, J. P., ... & Aiden, E. L. (2011). Quantitative analysis of culture using millions of digitized books. science, 331(6014), 176-182.

Title: WordNet
Description: Machine-readable dictionary with semantic relations for English.
Associated_Publication: Miller GA. WordNet: a lexical database for English. Communications of the ACM. 1995;38:39-41.; Fellbaum C. WordNet: An Electronic Lexical Database. MIT Press; 1998.

Title: Edinburgh Associative Thesaurus

Title: Euro WordNet
Description: Wordnets for several European languages

Title: COCA
Description: 440 million word corpus of contemporary American English

Title: COHA
Description: 385 million word corpus of historical American English
Associated_Publication: Davies, M. (2011). The Corpus of Contemporary American English as the First Reliable Monitor Corpus of English. Literary and Linguistic Computing 25: 447-65.

Title: Intercontinental Dictionary Series
Description: Comparative lexical database

Title: Phoible
Description: Cross-linguistic phoneme inventory data
Associated_Publication: Moran, S., & McCloy, D., & Wright, R. (eds.) 2014. PHOIBLE Online. Leipzig: Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology.

Title: P-base
Description: Database of several thousand sound patterns in 500+ languages

Title: Phonetic Similarity database
Description: Similarity ratings for 51 segments

Title: AUTOTYP
Description: Typological database
Associated_Publication: Bickel, B. & J. Nichols, 2002. Autotypologizing databases and their use in fieldwork. In Proc. Int. LREC Workshop on Resources and Tools in Field Linguistics. Las Palmas, 25-26 May 2002.

Title: KAIST Korean Corpus
Description: 70 million Korean eojeol corpus.

Title: Europarl
Description: Parallel text with up to 60 million words for 20 languags

Title: Parallel Bible Corpus
Description: Parallel corpus of the bible with around 900 languages from around 80 different language families.

Title: Universal Declaration of Human Rights
Description: Parallel corpus of the declaration of human rights for 400 languages

Title: Wacky Corpus
Description: Corpora with up to 2 billion words for English, French, German and Italian

Title: ASJP Automated Similarity Judgment Project
Description: Word lists of around 6000 languages

Title: Ethnologue
Description: Comprehensive catalogue of the world's languages.

Title: Glottolog
Description: Comprehensive reference information for the world's languages.

Title: Open parallel corpus
Description: A collection of parallel corpora from the wb.

Title: Rosetta Collection in The Internet Archive
Description: Media files and documents about the languages from the world collected by the Rosetta foundation.

Title: World Bank Open Data
Description: Demographic and geographical data on the world's countries

Title: Sensory experience ratings
